description: If you thought Star Wars was only for nerds, think again—even bartenders are getting in on the fun. Inspired by characters and creatures from the science fiction classic,&nbsp;bartenders are whipping up drinks that are out of this world.One example is Benjamin Schiller's Sarlacc Pit, named for the flesh-eating monster from "Star Wars: Return of the Jedi."The Sarlacc Pit is made with El Dorado's five-year-old gold&nbsp;rum, ginger syrup, lime juice, bitters, and Schiller's own Han's Mix, a tweaked version of the Don's Mix #1 from famed Tiki bartender Donn Beach.Plus, it is fittingly named for a desert planet like Tatooine. So if you're ever in the mood for a star wars-themed cocktail this May 4, check out this recipe.
name: Sarlaac Pit
recipeIngredient: ¾ oz. Lime juice, freshly squeezed
3 dashes of Bittermens Elemakule Tiki bitters
Mint sprig and twisty straws for garnish

recipeInstructions.name: Combine the ingredients with crushed ice in a tiki glass.
recipeInstructions.text: Combine the ingredients with crushed ice in a tiki glass.

recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with a mint sprig or other desired garnishes.
recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with a mint sprig or other desired garnishes.
